framework.control

Class ProsumerConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.control.ProsumerConnector

  • public final class ProsumerConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Connector to the framework for prosumer modules. Here the ID of the module is added as a token.
    Author:
    Stefan Werner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProsumerConnector(framework.control.ModuleActionHandler handler, java.lang.String moduleId)
      Instantiates a new prosumer connector.

    • Method Detail

      • addStreamListener

        public boolean addStreamListener(framework.model.Port port,
                                 StreamListener listener)
                          throws BrokerException,
                                 AuthorizationException
        Adds a stream listener. Listener methods will get called whenever a stream at the given port is closed.

        Required rights: OBSERVE_STREAMS

        Parameters:
        port - the port
        listener - the listener
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:
        ModuleActionHandler.addStreamListener(java.lang.String, framework.model.Port, module.iface.StreamListener)

      • checkAndLock

        public int checkAndLock(ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                        java.lang.String[] path)
                 throws BrokerException,
                        ModuleException,
                        AuthorizationException
        Checks and locks an element at given path. See Provider.checkAndLock(ProviderPort, String[]) for more details.

        Required rights: READ_DATA, WRITE_DATA

        Parameters:
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result code (see Provider interface)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:
        framework.iface.ModuleActionHandler#checkAndLock(java.lang.String, framework.model.ProsumerPort, java.lang.String[])

      • createFolder

        public int createFolder(ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                        java.lang.String[] path)
                 throws BrokerException,
                        ModuleException,
                        AuthorizationException
        Creates a folder. If necessary parent folders are created automatically. See Provider.createFolder(ProviderPort, String[]) for more details.

        Required rights: READ_DATA, WRITE_DATA

        Parameters:
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        path - the path of the folder to create
        Returns:
        the result code (see Provider interface)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:
        framework.iface.ModuleActionHandler#createFolder(java.lang.String, framework.model.ProsumerPort, java.lang.String[])

      • getChildElements

        public java.util.Set<DataElement> getChildElements(ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                                                   java.lang.String[] path,
                                                   boolean recursive)
                                            throws BrokerException,
                                                   ModuleException,
                                                   AuthorizationException
        Gets the child elements under a given parent path.

        Required rights: READ_DATA

        Parameters:
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        path - the path of the parent element
        recursive - set to true to get all children recursively (relative depth >= 1)
        Returns:
        the child elements (null if non existing/error or no children supported, for example within file elements)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:
        framework.iface.ModuleActionHandler#getChildElements(java.lang.String, framework.model.ProsumerPort, java.lang.String[], boolean)

      • getSupportedModuleCommands

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedModuleCommands(framework.model.Port sendingPort,
                                                                  java.lang.String[] path)
                                                           throws BrokerException,
                                                                  ModuleException,
                                                                  AuthorizationException
        Gets the supported module commands (for a particular path).

        Required rights: SEND_COMMAND

        Parameters:
        sendingPort - the sending port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the supported module commands (may be null, for example if module does not answer before a timeout occurs)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

      • move

        public int move(ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                java.lang.String[] srcPath,
                java.lang.String[] destPath)
         throws BrokerException,
                ModuleException,
                AuthorizationException
        Moves an element from one path to another within the same port. If necessary parent folders for destination are created automatically. Will NOT overwrite an existing destination element. See Provider.move(ProviderPort, String[], String[]) for more details.

        Required rights: READ_DATA, WRITE_DATA

        Parameters:
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        srcPath - the source path
        destPath - the destination path
        Returns:
        the result code (see Provider interface)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:
        framework.iface.ModuleActionHandler#move(java.lang.String, framework.model.ProsumerPort, java.lang.String[], java.lang.String[])

        public java.io.InputStream readData(ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                                    java.lang.String[] path)
                             throws BrokerException,
                                    ModuleException,
                                    AuthorizationException
        Reads data from an element at given path.

        Required rights: READ_DATA

        Parameters:
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port

        Returns:

        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:

      • sendModuleCommand

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sendModuleCommand(framework.model.Port sendingPort,
                                                                          java.lang.String command,
                                                                          java.lang.String[] path,
                                                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
                                                                   throws BrokerException,
                                                                          ModuleException,
                                                                          AuthorizationException
        Sends a module command.

        Required rights: SEND_COMMAND

        Parameters:
        sendingPort - the sending port
        command - the command
        path - the path (may be null)
        properties - the properties (may be null)
        Returns:
        the answer from module (may be null, for example if module does not answer before a timeout occurs)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:
        framework.iface.ModuleActionHandler#sendModuleCommand(java.lang.String, framework.model.Port, java.lang.String[], java.util.Map)

      • subscribe

        public boolean subscribe(ProsumerPort prosumerPort,
                         java.lang.String[] path,
                         boolean recursive,
                         DataElementEventListener dataElementEventListener)
                  throws BrokerException,
                         AuthorizationException
        Subscribes to element events for a specific port and (recursive) path.

        Required rights: RECEIVE_EVENTS

        Parameters:
        prosumerPort - the prosumer port
        path - the path
        recursive - the recursive
        dataElementEventListener - the data element event listener
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:
        framework.iface.ModuleActionHandler#subscribe(java.lang.String, framework.model.ProsumerPort, java.lang.String[], boolean)

      • writeData

        public java.io.OutputStream writeData(ProsumerPort sendingProsumerPort,
                                      java.lang.String[] path)
                               throws BrokerException,
                                      ModuleException,
                                      AuthorizationException
        Writes data to an element at given path, creates it if necessary (including parent folders).

        Required rights: WRITE_DATA

        Parameters:
        sendingProsumerPort - the sending prosumer port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the output stream to write to (null if read only)
        Throws:
        BrokerException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
        ModuleException - if an exception in a connected module occurs (usually wraps such exceptions)
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        See Also:
        framework.iface.ModuleActionHandler#writeData(java.lang.String, framework.model.ProsumerPort, java.lang.String[])
